io.prismic
Class Api

java.lang.Object
  io.prismic.Api

public class Api
extends java.lang.Object

Embodies an API endpoint, from which it is possible to make queries. This object should be instantiated once per webpage on your project, at the very beginning of the webpage, and then used for every subsequent document query.

Constructor Detail

Api

public Api(Api.ApiData apiData,
           java.lang.String accessToken,
           Cache cache,
           Logger logger,
           FragmentParser fragmentParser)
Constructor to build a proper API object. This is not to build an API object from an API endpoint (the most usual case). In this case, you'll use the API.get method.

Parameters:
apiData - the data retrieved from the API document, ready to be stored in memory
accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)
cache - instance of a class that implements the Cache interface, and will handle the cache
logger - instance of a class that implements the Logger interface, and will handle the logging
fragmentParser - instance of a class that implements the FragmentParser interface, and will handle the JSON to Fragment conversion.
Method Detail

get

public static Api get(java.lang.String url,
                      java.lang.String accessToken,
                      Cache cache,
                      Logger logger,
                      FragmentParser fragmentParser)
Entry point to get an API object. Example: API api = API.get("https://lesbonneschoses.prismic.io/api", null, new Cache.BuiltInCache(999), new Logger.PrintlnLogger());

Parameters:
url - the endpoint of your prismic.io content repository, typically https://yourrepoid.prismic.io/api
accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)
cache - instance of a class that implements the Cache interface, and will handle the cache
logger - instance of a class that implements the Logger interface, and will handle the logging
fragmentParser - instance of a class that implements the FragmentParser interface, and will handle the JSON to Fragment conversion.
Returns:
the usable API object

get

public static Api get(java.lang.String url,
                      java.lang.String accessToken,
                      Cache cache,
                      Logger logger)

get

public static Api get(java.lang.String url,
                      java.lang.String accessToken)
Entry point to get an API object. Example: API api = API.get("https://lesbonneschoses.prismic.io/api", null);

Parameters:
url - the endpoint of your prismic.io content repository, typically https://yourrepoid.prismic.io/api
accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)
Returns:
the usable API object

get

public static Api get(java.lang.String url)
Entry point to get an API object. Example: API api = API.get("https://lesbonneschoses.prismic.io/api");

Parameters:
url - the endpoint of your prismic.io content repository, typically https://yourrepoid.prismic.io/api
Returns:
the usable API object

public java.lang.String getAccessToken()

getCache

public Cache getCache()

getFragmentParser

public FragmentParser getFragmentParser()

getRefs

public java.util.List<Ref> getRefs()
From a properly built API object, returns the ref IDs (points in a prismic.io repository's timeline, whether in the past, in the present, or in the future) to which the passed credentials give access.

Returns:
the list of ref IDs

getBookmarks

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getBookmarks()
From a properly built API object, returns the map associating the bookmark names to their document IDs. Therefore, to get a bookmarked document's ID, it will look like this: api.getBookmarks().get("home")

Returns:
the map <name, id>

getForm

public Form.Search getForm(java.lang.String form)
From a properly built API object, return a Form object that will allow to perform queries. Currently, all the forms offered by prismic.io are SearchForms, but this will change. To use it: api.get("everything").query(.....)......

Parameters:
form - the name of the form to query on
Returns:
the form to use to perform the query
See Also:
Form.Search

getMaster

public Ref getMaster()
From a properly built API object, returns the ref ID (points in a prismic.io repository's timeline, whether in the past, in the present, or in the future) of the master ref (the one presently live).

Returns:
the ref object representing the master ref

public java.lang.String getOAuthInitiateEndpoint()
